Message.Title: InfoWorld: A Look At The Black Underbelly Of Windoze 8.1
Message.Msg: Oh, dear, M$hills.....8.1 is a disaster too. And...windoze 8.1 sends your local searches to bloody awful bing without your permission....yoiu have to disable it...and that's not easy for the casual user.

Message.Title: 8.1 sends your local searches to rubbish bing without your permission
Message.Msg: On Infoworld now:- The new Win8.1 Smart Search -- invoked by default through the Windows 8.1 Search charm -- not only searches your computer for the string you specify. It also, all by itself, gathers up the terms and runs them through a Bing search. Making this cool new feature all the more lovable, Microsoft has officially announced that advertisers will be able to dish up advertising to your computer, based on the searches you perform on your computer. Bing Ads will be an integral part of the new Windows 8.1 Smart Search experience. Now, with a single campaign setup, advertisers can connect with consumers across Bing, Yahoo, and the new Windows Search with highly relevant ads for their search queries. In addition, Bing Ads will include Web previews of websites and the latest features like site links, location, and call extensions, making it easier for consumers to complete tasks and for advertisers to drive qualified leads. Unless you make Smart Search dumb, you not only hand Microsoft a complete history of all of your local computer search terms, you open your machine up to even more lovely ads, doled out on the Search results pane. If you search for "flugelhorn" on your local computer -- not on the Web, mind you, but on your own computer -- the results that Windows 8.1 shows you will include advertisements for flugelhorns on eBay and Amazon (no, I'm not joking -- try it), local flugelhorn manufacturers, flugelhorn party consultants, and no doubt some day flugelhorn addiction services.

Message.Title: Most Undervalued Stock, Greatest Upside Potential
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) currently $7.89 is starting to breakout big and looks ready to explode. CCUR has only 8.754mm s/o, a market cap of $69.07mm, cash of $22.37mm, no debt, and an enterprise value of $46.7mm. CCUR's enterprise value is only 0.74X revenues of $63.23mm, 6.55X operating cash flow of $7.13mm, and 8.34X free cash flow of $5.6mm. CCUR's EPS was up 175% last quarter and it just raised its dividend by 100% to $0.48 per share for a yield of 6.1%. CCUR is the leader of some of the world's hottest technologies! CCUR leads the video on demand (VOD) delivery business with over 2.4mm streams deployed worldwide and 4 of America's 6 largest cable TV operators as clients. The #2 VOD technology vendor Seachange (SEAC) is currently trading for $11.50 and has an enterprise value of $262.4mm or 1.68X revenues of $156.11mm, 15.05X operating cash flow of $17.43mm, and 19.32X free cash flow of $13.58mm. An enterprise value of 1.68X revenues would value CCUR at $14.69 per share. An enterprise value of 15.05X operating cash flow will value CCUR at $14.81 per share. An enterprise value of 19.32X free cash flow will value CCUR at $14.91 per share. CCUR also has the leading Big Data Analytics software being used by pay-TV operators. CCUR tracks the behavior of 35mm pay-TV subscribers and has processed 15 billion media transactions. Big Data Analytics is the hottest space on Wall Street. Tableau Software (DATA) recently had its IPO at $31 and hit a new 52-week high on Monday of $63 for a gain of 103%. DATA's enterprise value is currently 25X revenues. Another Big Data stock Splunk (SPLK) currently has an enterprise value of 22X revenues. CCUR's enterprise value is currently only 0.74X revenues! CCUR will likely break through its 52-week high of $8.45 in the upcoming days and explode to double digits! CCUR's business is booming as pay-TV operators upgrade to provide multi-screen/TV Everywhere access, Network (cloud based) DVR services, and start-over/look-back services!

Topic.Title: 8.1 sends your local searches to rubbish bing without your permission

Message.Msg: From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia: A Trojan horse, or Trojan, is a non-self-replicating type of malware which gains privileged access to the operating system while appearing to perform a desirable function but instead drops a malicious payload, often including a backdoor allowing unauthorized access to the target's computer. These backdoors tend to be invisible to average users, but may cause the computer to run slow. Trojans do not attempt to inject themselves into other files like a computer virus. Trojan horses may steal information, or harm their host computer systems.[1] Trojans may use drive-by downloads or install via online games or internet-driven applications in order to reach target computers. The term is derived from the Trojan Horse story in Greek mythology because Trojan horses employ a form of “social engineering,” presenting themselves as harmless, useful gifts, in order to persuade victims to install them on their computers.[2][3][4][5][6] And!!! Best of all!!! It comes preinstalled on W8.1 disguised as the operating system...

Message.Title: Greenland Ice Sheet Growing: Peer reviewed study
Message.Msg: MMGW disproved - AGAIN! Greenland Ice Sheet Growing: Peer reviewed study Another nail in the Alarmists' coffins. A paper published by the Journal of Glaciology by researcher Kenneth Jezek (Link) "the southern half of Greenland was thickening by ~0.20 ± 0.06 m/year, with a possible increase in thickening rate to 0.28 ± 0.02 m/year for the later part of the record." Reference Jezek, K.C. 2012. Surface elevation and velocity changes on the south-central Greenland ice sheet: 1980-2011. Journal of Glaciology 58: 1201-1211. What was learned The Ohio State University (USA) researcher reports that the most recent data show that thinning rates areslowing at several sites just east of the divide, and that the elevation at the divide continues to increase. What it means "These results," in the words of Jezek, "show that the Greenland ice sheet is changing from terminus to divide," and that "measurement strategies designed to predict future changes and to estimate volumetric changes across the ice sheet need to appropriately cover the entirety of the ice sheet.

Topic.Title: Greenland Ice Sheet Growing: Peer reviewed study

Message.Msg: "Greenland Ice Sheet Growing" THAT IS NOT WHAT Kenneth C. Jezek concluded, you lying moe. Below is right off his Web page. ******************************************* Jakobshavn Glacier, Greenland's largest glacier, drains approximately 6.5% of the ice sheet and is a key factor in the mass balance of the Greenland Ice Sheet. Although the interior of the ice sheet is in a state of balance, the coastal region has continued to thin. While there has been variability in the velocity of Jakobshavn over time the ice front has steadily retreated. It wasn't until the year 2000 that an increase in ice flow velocities was recorded and an increasing trend observed. ************************************************ The melting is accelerating, moe.

Message.Title: "The Death of Motely Fools" As a Reputable Investing Source
Message.Msg: Breaking News: Yes, after being exposed as being nothing more than pimps for the Google corporation, financial houses and global investors have really turned sour to the Motley Fools website. This astounding collapse of trust in all thing Motley by investors around the world has them not only removing MF from their computer news source feeds, but also by privately passing along to their friends and neighbors just how biased MF is and how in the tank their "articles" are really just cheesy hype to promote Google. Apparently, the over-the-top and shameless, non-stop harangues against Microsoft has finally backfired. As background, MF has for a very long time now tagged their "investing articles' with their own advertisement for their not-so brilliant article called "The Death of the PC" -- which is little more than pointing out that cloud computing is the future. The irony is that it is Microsoft that is quickly dominating the entire cloud computing market while the Motley Fools sit at their keyboards farting. "It's like saying water is wet," said one investor. "I mean, if there is any 'death" here, it is the complete death of Motley Fools as a credible investing source anymore. They obviously don't realize what a bad joke they have become in the eyes of serious investors." Another investor quipped, "well, they finally lived up to the 'fools" part of their name. They are so pathetically aligned with Google, I think they should now rename themselves the Motley Pimps," he said laughing out loud.

Message.Title: Obama brags how he's bring smart, 21st century techology to government...LM
Message.Msg: ObamaCare: The president brags about how he's bringing smart, 21st century technology to government. But the news surrounding that talk provides a showcase for how inept his administration is when it comes to IT. 'We've made huge swaths of your government more efficient and more transparent, and more accountable than ever before," President Obama claimed Monday. But the very next day, AP reported that a "computer system problem" has caused his administration to delay yet another piece of ObamaCare for at least a year. The delay stems from a conflict between the law's premium penalties for smokers and its restrictions on insurance rates. While ObamaCare forbids insurance companies from adjusting rates based on health status, it does let insurers impose a significant premium penalty on smokers.

Message.Title: Koch Brothers fund effort to undermine Tea Party support of solar energy in Georgia
Message.Msg: On Thursday, the Georgia Public Service Commission will decide whether to require Georgia Power, the state’s sole investor-owned electricity provider, to significantly expand its use of solar energy. The fight to diversify the state’s power supply has united some unlikely bedfellows — namely, renewable energy advocates and leaders of the Atlanta Tea Party. Tea Party members supporting the solar expansion see it as a simple free market issue. They believe consumers have the right to choose where their electricity comes from and shouldn’t be forced to remain dependent on a single source, especially in light of the rapidly declining cost of solar. Despite the Tea Party’s support, Americans For Prosperity, a conservative group funded by the Koch brothers, came out against the proposed solar measure last week — launching what it calls “a multi-pronged, grassroots driven initiative” urging activists to pressure members of the PSC to reject the solar expansion THE KOCH BROS ARE CRIMINALS
